business.headline: Why more insurance policyholders are turning to private grievance platformsAs claim rejections soar and official channels frustrate, policyholders turn to private grievance platforms. Experts warn regulatory reform and competent brokers could restore trust in India's struggling insurance system.

From EMIs to assets: How home loans are creating India's new wealth generationIn India, home loans are doing more than financing houses—they are quietly shaping the country's next generation of wealth. Every EMI paid is becoming a step toward financial growth and stability.

Crypto in slump. 3 reasons why Bitcoin, Ethereum and Dogecoin are strugglingThe cryptocurrency market is struggling, and major tokens are taking the hit. Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Dogecoin have all dropped as investors react to a mix of macroeconomic uncertainty, liquidations, and upcoming market events.

EPFO 3.0 roll-out likely delayed, ATM withdrawals pushed to 2026The wait for EPFO 3.0 just got longer. While the update is set to make provident fund services more seamless, its highlight feature, ATM withdrawals, is now likely to come into effect in 2026.

Why Trump's MAGA is impossible without Indian CEOsThe list of Indian-origin CEOs in global technology and beyond is long and growing. Satya Nadella leads Microsoft, Sundar Pichai is at Alphabet and Google, Arvind Krishna heads IBM, Shantanu Narayen runs Adobe, and Neal Mohan was appointed YouTube CEO in 2023.

Trump slaps 100% tariff on branded pharma drug imports: Should India worry?For now, experts say that India's generic drug exports remain largely safe, though any future extension of US tariffs to generics could disrupt the sector and investor sentiment.
Dalal Street outlook: Is market entering a consolidation phase?

Cipla, Dr. Reddy's, Sun Pharma: Why pharma stocks are falling todayAt 9:39 am, Sun Pharma fell 2.94% to Rs 1,548, Cipla dropped 1.92% to Rs 1,475, and Dr. Reddy's Laboratories slipped 1.17% to Rs 1,275. The sector's decline added to the broader weakness in equity markets.

Pharma stocks drag stock markets lower after Trump's 100% drug tariff threatAt 9:24 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 240.39 points at 80,919.29, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 86.30 points to 24,804.55. Broader market indices also mirrored the weakness.

Exclusive: Adani set to acquire Sahara's crown jewel assets in landmark dealThe deal stems from a long-running dispute ongoing before the Supreme Court led by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) against key Sahara entities, requiring them to refund investor money.

Ananya Birla on building Swatantra, making music, and leading with valuesWhether running businesses, writing songs, or leading teams, Ananya Birla believes in giving her all. Speaking at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she reflected on her early start, her discipline, and the values that guide her.

Ananya Birla on balancing business, music, and leadershipAnanya Birla wears many hats - entrepreneur, musician, and leader. At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she shared how discipline, values, and passion have helped her navigate each role with purpose.

CBDT extends deadline for filing income tax audit reports to October 31CBDT said the move comes in response to representations from professional bodies, including Chartered Accountant associations, highlighting difficulties in completing audit reports on time.

Sensex tumbles over 500 points, Nifty falls below 25,000The Nifty 50 slipped 0.66% to 24,890.85, while the BSE Sensex eased 0.68% to 81,159.68, logging their longest losing run since early March. Over the past five sessions, the Nifty and Sensex have fallen 2.1% and 2.2%, respectively.

Stock market investing: Can AI really beat human experts?At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts discussed how AI is changing stock market investing, whether it can replace traditional methods, and what role human judgement will continue to play.

How not to lose money on the stock market? Experts answer at India Today ConclaveWith increasing participation in equities, especially after the strong returns of the past few years, experts mentioned the importance of patience, asset allocation and realistic expectations.

World's second-richest man pledges to give away 95% of his $373 billion fortuneMuch of his philanthropy is channelled through the Ellison Institute of Technology (EIT), a for-profit organisation based at the University of Oxford. EIT works on global challenges such as healthcare, climate change, food insecurity, and AI research.

Where are Indians heading this festive season? Top destinations revealedCurious where Indians are planning to travel this festive season? From bustling international cities to iconic domestic spots, these are the destinations topping the list.

Festive gold rush: Should you buy jewellery or gold stocks this season?Indians love buying gold, especially in the festive season. However, Dalal Street has also seen an upward trend, with positive domestic developments such as GST rate cuts and income tax reforms earlier in the year.

Court questions Priya Kapur's plea to disclose Sunjay Kapur assets in sealed coverThe application was filed in the ongoing inheritance dispute involving Karisma Kapoor's children, who are claiming a share in their late father's personal assets.
Gold slips from record high. 3 factors explainedGold retreated from its record peak this week, leaving investors curious about what triggered the fall. Here are three key factors behind the dip.

Insurance complaints surge 45% in Q2 as health policies drive cases: ReportRising disputes reveal persistent mis-selling and transparency gaps in India's insurance sector, with policyholders increasingly turning to platforms like Insurance Samadhan to assert rights and seek timely redressal.

Missed the ITR deadline? You will now have to file under new tax regimeWondering what happens if you miss the ITR filing deadline? Did you know you'll automatically be shifted to the new tax regime, losing the option to choose the old one?

Which are the best sectors to invest on Dalal Street right now? Check best picksFrom FMCG to NBFCs, railways, autos and even shipbuilders, analysts see opportunities across a range of sectors as Dalal Street faces volatility.

Sensex, Nifty trade flat after opening lower amid F&O expiry, US visa curbsAt 9:28 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 95.55 points at 81,811.18, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 25.65 points to 25,082.55. Broader market indices also traded in the green, though overall sentiment on Dalal Street remained mixed.

Atlanta Electricals IPO allotment out: Check your status, listing date and GMPInvestors who applied for Atlanta Electricals IPO can check their allotment status through either the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited.

Government imposes import curbs on plain silver jewellery till March 2026The restrictions have been introduced in the wake of an import of plain silver jewellery from under preferential duty exemptions rising steeply during April-June 2024-25 to April-June 2025-26.
Should investors be cautious of IT stocks amid H-1B visa changes?With ongoing changes in visa fees and policies, analysts say the outlook for the sector has turned uncertain in the short run.

How NPCI powers half the world's digital payments on just Rs 500 croreNational Payments Corporation of India handles 46% of the world's digital transactions. UPI alone processes 3,729 transactions per second.

Cabinet clears Rs 1,866 crore productivity bonus for railway staffRailway employees are in for festive cheer as the Union Cabinet has approved a productivity-linked bonus, benefiting lakhs of staff members.

Should you have two credit cards? Here's what you need to knowCredit card usage is on the rise in India, and many people are wondering if having a second card makes sense. From rewards to financial flexibility, here's what you should know before applying for another card.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as profit booking continues; Tata Motors falls over 2%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 386.47 points to 81,715.63, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 112.60 points to close at 25,056.90. Broader market indices also ended lower, with sectoral breadth largely negative, except for pharma stocks, which managed modest gains.

Why your cashless insurance claim isn't always 'cashless'Cashless claims promise convenience, but long delays, unclear policies, and unjust deductions often leave patients stressed. Understanding your rights and navigating the system proactively can prevent financial and medical headaches.

PPF, SCSS, SSY: Are Small Saving Scheme interest rates set to change?As the September 30 announcement approaches, savers are wondering if interest rates on popular small saving schemes like PPF, SCSS, and Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY) will change. Here's what you need to know.

How to buy gold the right way this festive seasonGold shopping is a festive tradition for many Indian families, but with rising prices and endless options, making the right choice can feel tricky. Here's how you can buy gold the right way this season.

H-1B crackdown cracks the rupee. Know why INR hit an all-time lowEconomists estimate that remittances, the money Indians abroad send back, could drop by around $400 million. For a country that relies on foreign money flowing in, that's significant.

Union Cabinet likely to clear bonus for railway staff soon: Government sourcesThe bonus, usually extended to non-gazetted railway employees, is meant to recognise their contribution to the efficiency and performance of one of India's most crucial transport networks.

Income tax audit 2025: Deadlines, rules and penalties you must knowThe clock is ticking for taxpayers who fall under the audit bracket. With the income tax audit deadline for FY 2024–25 just around the corner, here's a quick look at key dates, rules, and penalties.

Confused between Swiggy and Eternal stock? Here's what experts suggestMarket experts say the two companies are in very different positions when it comes to earnings visibility and investor confidence.

entertainment.headline: Madharaasi OTT release: When and where to watch Sivakarthikeyan's action thriller Director AR Murugadoss's 'Madharaasi', featuring actor Sivakarthikeyan is set to premiere on Prime Video on October 1, 2025. The film also features actors Rukimini Vasanth, Vidyut Jamwal and others in key roles.

Rajat Bedi jumps to ninth spot on IMDb India after Ba***ds success Actor Rajat Bedi has risen from 954th to the ninth position on IMDb India. The jump follows his role in Aryan Khan's directorial debut series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood', which is currently streaming on Netflix.

Anya Singh's rebirth with The Ba***ds of Bollywood: She's winning hearts and how! Anya Singh's performance in 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' has earned widespread recognition. The actor's journey from a non-filmy background to the spotlight highlights her determination and growing influence in Indian entertainment.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 33: Baseer apologises to Awez's family, Nagma Baseer Ali apologised to Awez Darbar's family and his girlfriend, Nagma Mirajkar, who was also a part of 'Bigg Boss 19.'  He had earlier claimed that Awez was disloyal to Nagma. In episode 33, Awez watched a clip of Baseer discussing the matter with Amaal Mallik and Zeishan Quadri.

Nagarjuna, Tabu, Sreeleela and celebs dazzle at Kalyanaraman family's Navratri Puja Like every year, the Kalyanaraman family's Navratri celebrations in Thrissur, Kerala, were a grand event with a bevy of stars present. Take a look at who all attended the puja.

Farah Khan denies ignoring Aayush Sharma in viral video Farah Khan has dismissed claims of ignoring Aayush Sharma at an event as nonsense, clarifying that she did not see him in the rush and recently shot a vlog with him.

Parineeti, Imtiaz elated on Amar Singh Chamkila's International Emmy nomination After Diljit Dosanjh, actor Parineeti Chopra and director Imtiaz Ali expressed joy and gratitude as 'Amar Singh Chamkila' secured International Emmy nominations. The film has been nominated in the Best Actor and Best TV Movie categories.

Case against Pawan Kalyan fans for creating chaos at OG screening in Bengaluru Trouble has mounted for Pawan Kalyan fans after they created a chaos at a Bengaluru theatre. The film released in theatres on September 25.

Homebound cleared with 11 cuts, cricket scene trimmed, certain dialogues muted Filmmaker Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' was cleared by the censor board with 11 cuts. The film's runtime was also shortened by 77 seconds.

OG box office Day 1: Pawan Kalyan's film explodes to massive Rs 100-crore haul Pawan Kalyan's 'They Call Him OG' smashed Rs 100 crore on its opening day, including paid premieres. The gangster drama, directed by Sujeeth, has received glowing reviews from fans.

Farhan Akhtar moved by Dwayne Johnson's The Smashing Machine: Can't wait to see Dwayne Johnson impressed fans with his physical transformation in the upcoming biopic 'The Smashing Machine'. After getting international recognition, the film found a fan in Bolllywood actor Farhan Akhtar.

Janaawar review: Bhuvan Arora' show delivers hard-hitting take on caste, society 'Janaawar: The Beast Within' is a gripping crime drama set in a small town, with Bhuvan Arora shining as a cop balancing duty and family. The series explores caste, identity, and the darker sides of human nature. Read our review.

International Emmy Awards 2025 nominations full list: Chamkila, Ludwig get nods 2025 International Emmy nominations feature 64 contenders from 26 countries. United Kingdom leads with 12 nominations, followed by Brazil and South Africa. 'Ludwig' and 'Amar Singh Chamkila' received multiple nods.

Bhumi Pednekar on trolls: Resilience keeps me going in tough times Actor Bhumi Pednekar at India Today Mumbai Conclave on facing trolls, resilience, box-office lows, and finding courage beyond cinema.

Diljit Dosanjh, Amar Singh Chamkila nominated for International Emmys Diljit Dosanjh has earned an International Emmy nomination for Best Actor for his role in 'Amar Singh Chamkila', which is also competing for Best TV Movie, marking a global recognition of the legendary singer's story.

Video: Ektaa Kapoor talks Kyunki, motherhood and National Award win for Kathal Producer Ektaa Kapoor spoke about 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', motherhood and more during her appearance at India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She was present at the session titled 'Queen of Content: Woman Who Shaped Indian Screens'.

Did Ektaa Kapoor take a dig at Ram Kapoor's weight loss? Producer breaks silence Ektaa Kapoor shuts down speculation linking her post to Ram Kapoor, calling it a wild misinterpretation.
"I was talking about body image, not taking a dig," she said while speaking on Day One of India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025.

Varun Dhawan on Sunny Sanskari vs Kantara clash: There's room for all films Varun Dhawan's upcoming film 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' is a lighthearted entertainer designed to uplift moods rather than preach life lessons. The actor graced India Today Conclave 2025 on Thursday and called the film a mood-lifting entertainer.

Ektaa Kapoor on 30 years of content creation: It's not about success but relevance Ektaa Kapoor spoke on Day 1 of the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She shared insights on her three-decade-long journey, highlighting the importance of relevance over mere success.

general news.headline: MiG-21 testimony to India-Russia ties, not just aircraft: Rajnath at jet's farewellDefence minister Rajnath Singh said the MiG-21 is not just an aircraft but a testimony to India-Russia ties. He added that from the 1971 war to the Balakot airstrike, the jet has stood as a symbol of strength and valour for the armed forces.

Nato chief claims Modi, hit by tariffs, phoned Putin and asked for Ukraine planNATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte stated that Trump's tariffs on India are affecting Russia, prompting PM Modi to seek clarification from Putin on Moscow's strategy in Ukraine.

Trump slaps 100% tariff on branded pharma drug imports: Should India worry?For now, experts say that India's generic drug exports remain largely safe, though any future extension of US tariffs to generics could disrupt the sector and investor sentiment.

Lalu's kidney spills RJD beansJust ahead of the Bihar Assembly election, a rift within the RJD's first family is out in the open. In 2022, Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter, Rohini Acharya, donated her kidney to him in a transplant done in Singapore. Now, questions are being asked if Rohini was actually the donor. While she hints the doubts were being created at the behest of Tejashwi Yadav's trusted aide, Sanjay Yadav, her eldest brother, Tej Pratap Yadav, has sided with her.

Blood and snow: How Ladakh became a part of IndiaIt was the bravery and military campaign of Zorawar Singh Kahluria, a General of Jammu king Gulab Singh, that first brought Ladakh into the Dogra fold in 1834. The sale of Jammu and Kashmir by the British to Gulab Singh in 1846, and his great-grandson Hari Singh's signing of the treaty of accession in 1947, made Ladakh an integral part of India.

Voter roll revision like note ban, medicine in search of disease: Yogendra YadavWhile addressing a session at the ongoing 2025 India Today Conclave Mumbai, a flagship event of the India Today Group., Yogendra Yadav said, "SIR is not a voter list revision, it is a master, manipulative reset."

Asked about 'U' not getting bail, DY Chandrachud mentions 'P'. What's the case?Former CJI DY Chandrachud stressed that "every single individual who deserved bail got bail" during his tenure. To illustrate, he referred to the case of Congress leader Pawan Khera.

Foreign trips, iPhones: How molestation-accused Delhi baba 'lured' women studentsSwami Chaitanyananda Saraswati, the former head of a management institute in Vasant Kunj, is currently on the run after more than 15 women students accused him of molestation, blackmail and intimidation.

Why Indian elections are mostly free but rarely fairWhile Indian elections have become freer, they are much less fairer. At the heart of electoral democracy is the belief in a 'Level Playing Field' (LPL): every candidate and party who contests should begin from the same starting point. Instead, now we have a totally skewed race where those in power have a massive advantage over their rivals.

The MiG-21 truth: Pilots reveal the deadly power of F-16 killerFor over six decades, the MiG-21 defended India's skies and helped train generations of pilots. Yet, despite its reputation as a workhorse, upgrade and spares woes marred its legacy. As the Indian Air Force (IAF) restores its fleet of MiG-21, pilots who flew it defend the trusted war bird.

Supreme Court clears Rs 20,000-crore JSW acquisition deal for Bhushan SteelA bench led by Chief Justice of India BR Gavai on Friday approved JSW Steel's Rs 19,700-crore resolution plan, saying the company had met all the parameters required.

Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla recalls his experience of flying MiG-21Shukla, who flew the MiG-21 during his early years as an Air Force pilot before being selected as an astronaut, recalled the aircraft as an inseparable part of his aviation journey.

The Gucci glow-up: Alia Bhatt's boldest fashion era yetWith over a decade in the film industry, Alia's style has always been a source of inspiration - especially with her ethnic looks and effortlessly relatable choices. But ever since her Gucci contract, she's been pushing the envelope like never before, radiating a true global fashion appeal.

Tamil Nadu Minister says women in North India still judged by husbands, sparks rowTamil Nadu Industries Minister TRB Rajaa sparked controversy by comparing women in Tamil Nadu and North India. BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla criticised the remarks as insulting UP and Bihar women.

Surya asked to avoid political comments over Pak complaints at ICC hearing: SourcesThe ICC has advised India captain Suryakumar Yadav to avoid political statements after a PCB complaint over his tribute following the India-Pakistan group-stage clash. His dedication to Operation Sindoor and Pahalgam attack victims sparked controversy ahead of the Asia Cup final.

From EMIs to assets: How home loans are creating India's new wealth generationIn India, home loans are doing more than financing houses—they are quietly shaping the country's next generation of wealth. Every EMI paid is becoming a step toward financial growth and stability.

Astronaut shows vein-like patterns in world's largest Amazon RiverIn the image, shared from orbit, the Amazon appears almost like a living organism, its vast network of tributaries branching out like veins across tens of kilometres of floodplain.

Why Trump's MAGA is impossible without Indian CEOsThe list of Indian-origin CEOs in global technology and beyond is long and growing. Satya Nadella leads Microsoft, Sundar Pichai is at Alphabet and Google, Arvind Krishna heads IBM, Shantanu Narayen runs Adobe, and Neal Mohan was appointed YouTube CEO in 2023.

No Bumrah perks, but Mohammed Shami toiling to keep India comeback dream aliveIndia fast bowler Mohammed Shami is training behind the scenes, hoping to make an India comeback at the age of 35. People close to Shami have been infuriated by the preferential treatment given to some of the other players in the team.

Apple Watch Series 11 review: Come for sleep tracking, stay for long battery lifeThe new Apple Watch Series 11 looks and works almost similar to the Watch Series 10. But it does bring better battery life, which makes a real difference in use.

Shashi Tharoor's witty comeback to Suhel Seth's Oxford 'sole mate' remark goes viralOn X, Suhel Seth shared a picture from Oxford University, the site where the Oxford English Dictionary was created, and joked that the dictionary was Shashi Tharoor's "sole mate."

Bengaluru shop owner, aide brutally thrash woman accused of saree theft, arrestedA Bengaluru shopkeeper and his aide were arrested for publicly assaulting a woman accused of stealing Rs 91,500 worth of sarees. Videos show her being dragged and kicked. Police also arrested the woman for theft.

Microsoft cuts services to Israeli spy unit over alleged mass surveillance of PalestiniansMicrosoft has blocked the Israeli military's access to certain cloud and AI services after an investigation revealed its technology was used in widespread surveillance of Palestinian civilians.

Voter roll revision should be conducted every 5 years: Lawyer Ashwini UpadhyayWhile addressing a session at the ongoing 2025 India Today Conclave Mumbai, the Supreme Court lawyer known to be an ardent supporter of the voter revision rolls said that there shouldn't be a gap of 15-20 years to conduct the exercise.

sports.headline: Karun Nair WI series snub: Selectors moving on from batter, says Dinesh Karthik Dinesh Karthik believes that the India selectors have moved on from Karun Nair after the Karnataka batter was dropped from the squad for the West Indies Test series. Karun was replaced by Devdutt Padikkal in the team.

Shubman Gill in awe of Smriti Mandhana: She has the lazy elegance of Damien Martyn Women's World Cup: Shubman Gill said Smriti Mandhana plays with the "lazy elegance" of former Australian batter Damien Martyn. Mandhana recently became India's fastest centurion in ODIs.

People close to Shami have been infuriated by the preferential treatment given to some of the other players in the team.

Abhishek Sharma drops stylish Dubai pics, Guru Yuvraj has hilarious response Abhishek Sharma's latest post on Instagram got a hilarious comment from his guru Yuvraj Singh, who decided to have some fun at the expense of his young disciple. Abhishek posted images from his free time in Dubai.

Ashes: Joe Root eyes beyond milestone 100 vs Australia, confident in different England Joe Root promises England will approach the Ashes Down Under with a fresh mindset, that can toruble Australia. While a century in Australia remains elusive, his focus is on winning matches and reclaiming the urn.

PR Sreejesh reveals India senior team coach ambitions, wants World Cup glory In an exclusive interaction with India Today, PR Sreejesh said that he aims to coach the India men's senior team and win the World Cup with them. Sreejesh commented on his life after retirement, his mentor role with SG Pipers and much more.

IND vs WI: West Indies suffer big blow as Shamar Joseph ruled out of series West Indies suffered a big blow ahead of the India Test series as Shamar Joseph has been ruled out of the Test series against India, which will begin on October 2. Shamar has been replaced by Johann Layne in the lineup.

His dedication to Operation Sindoor and Pahalgam attack victims sparked controversy ahead of the Asia Cup final.

She now aims for historic milestones at the upcoming Women's World Cup, raising expectations and excitement.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
